intro: Spiranthera peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian spiral flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of petals. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses worldwide.
